User Service#

User Service Module

This module provides the UserService class for handling user-related operations, including:

  • Account creation

  • Input validation

  • Password management

It ensures validation and secure interactions with the database.

class UserService(db_session, lock)[source]#

Bases: object

Service class for user-related operations such as: - Creating user accounts - Validating user input - Updating user passwords

Initialize the UserService.

Parameters:

  • db_session (Callable[[], Session]) – A callable returning a new database session.

  • lock (Any) – A lock object to ensure thread-safe operations.

static validate_input(value, expected_type: type)[source]#

Validate that the input value is of the expected type.

Parameters:

  • value (Any) – The data to validate.

  • expected_type (type) – The expected data type.

Returns:

The validated data.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

ValueError – If the data type is incorrect.

create_user_account(name, email, password)[source]#

Create a new user account.

Ensures: - Name is valid - Email follows proper format - Password meets security requirements

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The user’s full name.

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • password (str) – The user’s password.

Returns:

The created user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

  • SQLAlchemyError – If any error occurs during account creation.

  • ValueError – If validation fails.

change_user_password(user_id, new_password)[source]#

Change a user’s password.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The user’s ID.

  • new_password (str) – The new password.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the operation.

Return type:

str

Raises:

  • ValueError – If validation fails.

  • SQLAlchemyError – If any error occurs during password update.
